articles.title: CBI Busts Transnational Cyber Fraud Network, Files Chargesheet Against 17
articles.summary: The Central Bureau of Investigation dismantled a transnational cyber fraud network operating across multiple countries. A chargesheet was filed against 17 accused involved in large-scale scams. The operation was reported in breaking news updates early Monday.

articles.title: Haryana Divests IPS Officer Shatrujeet Kapur of DGP Charge
articles.summary: Haryana government removed Shatrujeet Kapur from Director General of Police position overnight. A proposal with records of five IPS officers will be sent to UPSC on December 15 for empanelment. The Commission will prepare a panel of three officers for the state.

articles.title: One Killed, Two Injured in Blast at Jalandhar Scrap Shop
articles.summary: A blast at a scrap shop in Jalandhar killed Shivmangal alias Inder and injured two others late Sunday night. The deceased lived in rented accommodation in the city. Police are investigating the cause of the explosion.

articles.title: NIA Court Declares Delhi Blast Accused Muzaffar Rather Proclaimed Offender
articles.summary: An NIA court issued a notice declaring Muzaffar Rather, accused in a Delhi blast case, as a proclaimed offender. The notice was published in local papers and pasted at his house in Qazigund, south Kashmir. The action followed his failure to appear in court.

articles.title: Shinde Criticizes Opposition on Maharashtra Session's Last Day Over LoP Demand
articles.summary: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde slammed opposition parties on the final day of the assembly session for focusing solely on Leader of Opposition post. He accused them of ignoring substantive public issues in both Houses. The remarks came late Sunday.

articles.title: BJP Elevates Nitin Nabin as Working President, Focuses on Bengal Expansion
articles.summary: Bihar minister Nitin Nabin was appointed BJP's new Working President, stating priority to strengthen party organization. He expressed confidence in winning elections even in Bengal. The announcement was made late Sunday evening.

articles.title: Low 48% Turnout in Punjab Rural Body Polls Amid Violence Allegations
articles.summary: Polling for Punjab's zila parishad and block samiti elections concluded with only 48% voter turnout. Opposition parties alleged violence during the process across the state. Voting ended late Sunday amid subdued response.

articles.title: Delhi AQI Hits 461, Second-Worst December Day on Record
articles.summary: Delhi's air quality index reached 461 late Sunday, the highest this winter and second-worst December day ever. Weak winds and low temperatures trapped pollutants near the surface. The national capital recorded severe pollution levels.

articles.title: Woman Stabbed to Death Inside Delhi Temple, One Arrested
articles.summary: A 48-year-old woman was stabbed to death inside a temple in Delhi late Sunday. Police arrested one suspect following the incident. The motive remains under investigation.

articles.title: India Wins Third T20I Against South Africa by Seven Wickets in Dharamsala
articles.summary: India defeated South Africa by seven wickets in the third T20 International in Dharamsala. The match concluded late Sunday night. This victory marks a significant performance in the series.
